text: A true knight is fuller of bravery in the midst, than in the beginning of danger.
author: Philip Sidney

text: What is birth to a man if it shall be a stain to his dead ancestors to have left such an offspring?
author: Philip Sidney

text: The only disadvantage of an honest heart is credulity.
author: Philip Sidney

text: It is the nature of the strong heart, that like the palm tree it strives ever upwards when it is most burdened.
author: Philip Sidney

text: Commonly they must use their feet for defense whose only weapon is their tongue.
author: Philip Sidney

text: The ingredients of health and long life, are great temperance, open air, easy labor, and little care.
author: Philip Sidney

text: A brave captain is as a root, out of which, as branches, the courage of his soldiers doth spring.
author: Philip Sidney

text: Friendship is made fast by interwoven benefits.
author: Philip Sidney

text: Valor is abased by too much loftiness.
author: Philip Sidney

text: The first mark of valor is defence.
author: Philip Sidney

text: There is little hope of equity where rebellion reigns.
author: Philip Sidney

text: The tip no jewel needs to wear: The tip is jewel of the ear.
author: Philip Sidney

text: Give tribute, but not oblation, to human wisdom.
author: Philip Sidney

text: Contentions for trifles can get but a trifling victory.
author: Philip Sidney

text: It is against womanhood to be forward in their own wishes.
author: Philip Sidney

text: A noble cause doth ease much a grievous case.
author: Philip Sidney

text: The journey of high honor lies not in smooth ways.
author: Philip Sidney

text: A true knight us fuller of bravery in the midst, than in the beginning of danger.
author: Philip Sidney

text: Theatre: poor stepsister of the arts.
author: Philip Sidney
